intro: Pourouma folleata, commonly known as the "Brazilian arrowroot," is a herbaceous plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that develop into three-lobed fruits. Its rhizomes are rich in starch and have been traditionally used as a food source by indigenous communities. Due to its adaptability and nutritional value, it is also gaining attention for potential agricultural use in tropical regions.
